alert.note: Alert for Montgomery (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 11:08PM EDT until April 01 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EDT FOR NORTHERN MORGAN...HENDRICKS...NORTHEASTERN CLAY...NORTHEASTERN OWEN...BOONE...PUTNAM AND SOUTHEASTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... At 1108 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 10 miles east of Crawfordsville to 7 miles northwest of Greencastle to 8 miles east of Brazil, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Jamestown, Advance and New Ross around 1115 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Roachdale, Lebanon, Coatesville, Ulen, Groveland, Belle Union, Little Point, Eminence, Whitestown, North Salem, Amo, Stilesville, Danville, Monrovia, Clayton, Lizton, Brownsburg, Avon, Pittsboro, Brooklyn, Lake Hart, Plainfield, Mooresville and Clermont. This includes the following highways... Interstate 65 between mile markers 128 and 143. Interstate 70 between mile markers 29 and 69. Interstate 74 between mile markers 43 and 70. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for central and west central Indiana. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
